title: Initial Implementation Scope
context:
The CLAUDE-VUE-REWRITE.md spec describes a full migration (96-164 hours) including:
- Auth UI: 24 pages, 20+ components, 30+ hooks, 4 languages
- Admin Panel: 15+ pages, UI components, RTK Query â†’ TanStack Query migration

Your request says 'create 2 new Vue static projects' which could mean different scopes.
ambiguity: It's unclear whether you want just project scaffolding, full implementation, or something in between.
question: What scope should the initial implementation cover?

options.label: Scaffolding only
options.description: Create project structure, configure Vite/Tailwind/vue-i18n/Pinia, add placeholder files. No actual page implementation.

options.label: Scaffolding + Core patterns
options.description: Full scaffolding plus 2-3 example pages (SignIn, Dashboard) with all patterns established (API calls, composables, stores).

options.label: Full implementation
options.description: Port all 24 Auth UI pages and 15+ Admin Panel pages with all components, composables, and translations.

currentPatterns: Existing Auth UI: server/src/pages/views/ (24 files), Admin Panel: admin-panel/app/[lang]/ (29 page files)

title: Project Location & Structure
context:
Current root structure:
- server/ (Hono API + current Auth UI pages)
- admin-panel/ (Next.js admin)
- sdks/ (client SDKs)
- shared/ (shared types)
- docs/ (documentation)

The spec offers 3 deployment options:
- Option A: Separate builds (auth.foo.com, admin.foo.com)
- Option B: Single static build
- Option C: Monorepo with shared components in packages/
ambiguity: Where should the new Vue projects be created and should they share a common package?
question: Where should the Vue projects be located?

options.label: Root level (Option A)
options.description: Create auth-ui/ and admin-panel-vue/ in root alongside existing folders. Independent projects, no shared package.

options.label: Monorepo packages (Option C)
options.description: Create packages/auth-ui/, packages/admin-ui/, and packages/ui/ (shared Vue components). Requires workspace setup.

options.label: Replace existing
options.description: Create auth-ui/ in root and convert admin-panel/ in-place from Next.js to Vue.

currentPatterns: Root package.json is minimal (lint, docs), no workspaces configured

title: Admin Panel Component Library
context:
Current admin-panel uses shadcn/ui (Radix-based React components):
- 20+ UI components in admin-panel/components/ui/
- Built on @radix-ui/react-* primitives

For Vue, there's an official shadcn-vue port using Radix Vue primitives.
ambiguity: Should we use the official shadcn-vue CLI/components or manually create Vue equivalents?
question: How should the Admin Panel UI components be implemented?

options.label: Use shadcn-vue CLI (Recommended)
options.description: Install shadcn-vue and use CLI to add components. Matches existing patterns, well-maintained, TypeScript support.

options.label: Manual Vue components
options.description: Create custom Vue components from scratch. More control but more work and potential inconsistencies.

options.label: Use alternative library
options.description: Use a different Vue component library (PrimeVue, Vuetify, Naive UI, etc.).

currentPatterns: Current React components: admin-panel/components/ui/ (button, card, input, select, table, etc.)

title: API URL Configuration
context:
Current setup:
- Auth UI pages are server-rendered from Hono (same origin as API)
- Admin Panel uses NEXT_PUBLIC_SERVER_URI=http://localhost:8788

As static SPAs, both Vue apps need to call the Hono API server.
ambiguity: How should the Vue apps be configured to call the API server during development and production?
question: How should API URLs be configured for the Vue apps?

options.label: Environment variable (Recommended)
options.description: Use VITE_API_URL env var. Allows different URLs for dev (localhost:8788) and prod (api.example.com).

options.label: Relative URLs + proxy
options.description: Use relative API paths (/api/*) and configure Vite proxy for dev. Requires same-origin deployment in prod.

options.label: Hardcoded base URL
options.description: Hardcode the API URL in the code. Simple but inflexible for different environments.

currentPatterns: Admin uses: NEXT_PUBLIC_SERVER_URI in .env, Server runs on: localhost:8788
